page.title: 03GENERAL FARMING AROUND TRURO
page.content:
90% of the farmland around Truro is covered in grass. Most of this grassland is used by farmers for sheep or cattle to graze on.
{CORNISH HEDGES} ______________ The fields are enclosed by a particular kind of "hedge", often 6/7ft in height. This "hedge" is the traditional Cornish Hedge, which is a broad-based dry-stone wall, gradually tapering from the bottom upwards. On the top of the hedge shrubs and grasses grow. _____ About 5% of the remaining land is fertilized and used for pasture or to make silage. The retaining land is cultivated to produce root crops and broccoli.
